intro: Euodia subtrigonosperma, commonly known as the narrow-angled Chinese tallowtree, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to southern China. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The tree produces elliptical, three-angled fruits that are typically yellow when mature. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a leathery texture with a distinct aromatic scent when crushed. This species is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has been introduced to other parts of the world for horticultural purposes.
